main event: An unidentified object was observed in Detroit, Michigan on 10 June 1953, described as bright, round, and glowing, moving at high speed for 60 seconds.
interesting points: The object was reported to be larger than a star and moved in a climbing arc toward the north before disappearing over the northern horizon., The sighting had no sound and did not leave a trail or exhaust., The possibility of the object being of astronomical origin was eliminated based on its movements., The report was part of Project Blue Book, which investigated UFO sightings., Local airport checks found no aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
witness description: An AFROTIC cadet at Wayne University.
